benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/children - List children accounts

covered: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC19, TC20) validate successful retrieval with default and optional query parameters (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit).
Empty Response: TC07 and TC24 validate behavior when a parent has no children or after deletions (returns empty JSON array).
Query Parameters: Many combinations of valid parameters are covered (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC16).
Authorization/Authentication: Authentication missing (401) and insufficient-permission (403) cases are covered (TC11, TC12).
Input Validation & Errors: Invalid accountId format, non-existing account, malformed query values, and injection are covered (TC09, TC10, TC16, TC17).
Service/Error Conditions: Dependency unavailable and timeout scenarios are included (TC14, TC18) as well as explicit 404/400 handling for missing resources/invalid input.
Performance/Scale: A large-volume performance/scale case is present (TC15).
Regression & Integration: Regression (TC19), concurrency (TC21), audit integration and consistency checks (TC22), and data consistency after create/delete (TC23, TC24) are covered.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination (page/limit/offset) or behaviour when result sets are paged; large-data TC15 expects all 10,000 returned but API may require/allow pagination.
Caching Behavior & Headers: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behaviour (If-None-Match / 304 handling).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting, burst behavior or responses under high request rate (429).

Content Negotiation & Response Headers: No checks for Content-Type, charset, or Accept header handling; no tests for unexpected Accept values or binary/unsupported media type responses (e.g., 406/415).
Pagination performance realism: TC15 asserts <2s for 10,000 items but does not test server-side paging or memory/streaming; this could be unrealistic and masks pagination requirements.
Server 500/Internal Error: While 503 and 504 are present, there is no explicit scenario for generic 500 Internal Server Error from the service.
Invalid audit/query enum values: There is no test for invalid audit parameter values outside the allowed set (e.g., audit=VERBOSE) and expected error handling.
Rate/Concurrency correctness: While concurrency (TC21) exists, there are no tests for race conditions around simultaneous modifications (e.g., child created/deleted during list retrieval).
Pagination metadata: No tests to validate presence/format of pagination metadata (totalCount, next/prev links) if API supports it.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: include page/limit/offset queries, verify correct page contents, boundary conditions (last page, page out of range) and confirm server behaviour for very large result sets instead of returning all items in one response.
Add caching and conditional GET tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers, perform If-None-Match requests to elicit 304 Not Modified, and assert correct freshness/expiration behaviour.
Add rate limiting and throttling tests: simulate burst requests to verify 429 responses and headers (Retry-After); include stress tests to observe graceful degradation.
Validate response headers and content negotiation: assert Content-Type application/json, test Accept header variations, and verify error codes for unsupported media types or malformed Accept headers.
Add server-error scenario (500): simulate internal failures to ensure clients receive appropriate 500 responses and consistent error payloads.
Test invalid enum/query values: add cases for invalid audit values and combinations of query parameters that conflict, asserting 400 with clear error messages.

Refine large-data test to exercise pagination/streaming: instead of expecting an API to return 10k items in one response, test paged retrieval to reflect realistic API constraints and measure per-page performance.
Add race-condition tests around concurrent create/delete while listing to ensure consistency guarantees or document eventual consistency behavior.
